abstract: Great Britain is turning away countless non-European writers, artists and performers at its borders as a result of cumbersome and uneven immigration rules that are making it increasingly difficult for many arts organizations to include foreigners in their programs; the seemingly straightforward rules have proved so onerous and open to subjective misreading that even people who have been going to the country for years are being refused entry.
snippet: Many non-European artists and musicians are turned away from Britain because of new and often contradictory visa regulations.
lead_paragraph: Many non-European artists and musicians are turned away from Britain because of new and often contradictory visa regulations.

headline.main: For Artists and Performers, Britain Puts Out an Unwelcome Mat
